title: Using Merge Fields with Conga Sign Write-Back Tags in a PDF Template
author: Dan John
content:
Description: The customer would like to display the actual value of the write-back (wb) tag field in a PDF template, rather than the merge tag itself, when signing a document.
 
Issue: Currently, the merge tag for write-back fields is shown in the PDF template, but the customer prefers that the PDF display the actual value of the wb tag field after the document is signed.
 
Use Case: When a document is signed using Conga Sign, the customer wants the signed PDF to reflect the value of the wb tag field, instead of showing the merge tag placeholder. This enhancement would improve clarity and usability by ensuring that the signed document accurately reflects the data inputted during the signing process.
 
Request: Implement functionality to replace the merge tag with the actual value of the wb tag field in the PDF template upon document signing.

title: Resync Button for Conga Sign Transactions
author: Alex Casey
content:

A Resync button on individual Conga Sign Transactions would be the perfect solution to this issue.
 
Currently I am specifically experiencing this when a user reassigns a recipient, but the new recipient record is not created, and the new recipient does not receive an email. The audit trail says the recipient was reassigned and the user can't reassign to a new person again as the record thinks it has already been reassigned. 
 
The Conga Production Team is currently the only team who can kick off a "redrive" to fix this issue. I think creating a Resync Button would be a quick and easy way to always ensure that nothing went wrong before having to reach out to Conga Support. Since Conga Sign is only half native to Salesforce, there will always be issues where things do not line up all the way. This button would allow for much quicker fixes to records that may have just stumbled along the way to completion. title: Conga Sign should send most recent version for Saleforce File Versions (ContentVersions) Created on Same Day
author: Casey Shockley
content:
I would file this more as a 'bug' than an 'idea' or 'enhancement', but nonetheless.


Conga Sign currently does not distinguish correctly between Salesforce file versions when those versions were created on the same day. This can result in the incorrect version of the file being sent for signature when there is more than one version created on the same day that the most recent version was created.

The workaround is to either delete older file versions (unacceptable for our use case because we need to have history available), or to download the most recent file version and upload it back in as an entirely separate contentdocument and set that as primary (cumbersome workaround). We also can potentially catch this issue by previewing our file on the Conga Sign screen before sending, although users don't always do this or may not always see the version differences easily to catch the issue.

We are unfortunately going to have to create automation specifically to address this bug because it is not being fixed by Conga (or not in a timely fashion). The fact that Conga Sign will send out a version other than the most recent file version really reduces our faith in Conga Sign as a platform because certain version changes can be critical and these are documents going to our client or potential clients, therefore reducing our clients' faith in us if we accidentally send an older version of the file.

It should be relatively straightforward to order by ContentModifiedDate with the level of specificity necessary or IsLatest flag or utilize VersionNumber comparisons to identify the most recent version of a document.
